article.headline: Hartford 58, Brown 46
article.story: HARTFORD, Conn. -- Anthony Minor scored 15 points and had nine rebounds to lead Hartford to a 58-46 victory over Brown on Thursday night. Morgan Sabia added 11 points and eight rebounds for the Hawks (2-5), who built a 31-22 halftime lead and held on for the victory despite shooting 37.9 percent from the field (11 of 29) in the second half. Brown (3-3) cut the lead to 41-38 on Matt Sullivan's jumper with 13:31 left in the game, but Sabia countered with a 3-pointer. Minor's layup gave the Hawks a 52-43 advantage with 7:28 to play. He also finished with four blocks, four steals and three assists. Sullivan was 7 for 8 from the field, including 5 of 6 on 3-pointers, to finish with 19 points to lead the Bears, but they shot 34.8 percent from the field (16 for 46) as a team. Peter Sullivan added 11 points for Brown, which had 16 turnovers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
